body: We came to the fact that `OSX v10.10` alias ElCapitan embed `launchctl v3.x` however `macOS v10.11` alias Sierra embed `launchctl v4.x`, we tried to track down the problem deeper without success, if anyone can investigate it would be awesome (commands run by pm2 are [here](https://github.com/Unitech/pm2/blob/master/lib/API/Startup.js#L238) and template is just [here](https://github.com/Unitech/pm2/blob/master/lib/templates/init-scripts/launchd.tpl))

I can confirm the same error with the following versions:
OS         :10.11.6
node.js  :v7.4.0
PM2       :2.3.0

Same here:
OS : 10.11.6
Node.js : v6.9.4
PM2 : 2.3.0

@arctelix @PierrickMartos 

Could any one of you try the following commands:

```
launchctl load -w ~/Library/LaunchAgents/PM2.plist
launchctl start ~/Library/LaunchAgents/PM2.plist
```

Are there any errors?

If the above errors, please copy/paste here. Also, it'd be nice if you could send us a file (`.plist`) from either one of these directories:

```
~/Library/LaunchAgents/
/Library/LaunchAgents/
```

so that we have an example of what the differences could be? I didn't find any changelog for launchctl :|.

Yes of course, no error with 2 commands you gave:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1785711/22377537/a61f3cec-e4b2-11e6-8f14-a3ee5ce979bb.png)

Here is ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.google.keystone.agent.plist
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>Label</key>
	<string>com.google.keystone.user.agent</string>
	<key>LimitLoadToSessionType</key>
	<string>Aqua</string>
	<key>ProgramArguments</key>
	<array>
	  <string>/Users/username/Library/Google/GoogleSoftwareUpdate/GoogleSoftwareUpdate.bundle/Contents/Resources/GoogleSoftwareUpdateAgent.app/Contents/MacOS/GoogleSoftwareUpdateAgent</string>
	  <string>-runMode</string>
	  <string>ifneeded</string>
	</array>
	<key>RunAtLoad</key>
	<true/>
	<key>StartInterval</key>
	<integer>3623</integer>
	<key>StandardErrorPath</key>
	<string>/dev/null</string>
	<key>StandardOutPath</key>
	<string>/dev/null</string>
</dict>
</plist>
```

And one another from /Library/LaunchAgents/com.teamviewer.teamviewer.plist : 
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
	<key>Disabled</key>
	<false/>
	<key>KeepAlive</key>
	<true/>
	<key>Label</key>
	<string>com.teamviewer.teamviewer</string>
	<key>LimitLoadToSessionType</key>
	<array>
		<string>Aqua</string>
	</array>
	<key>ProgramArguments</key>
	<array>
		<string>/Applications/TeamViewer.app/Contents/MacOS/TeamViewer</string>
		<string>-RunAsAgent</string>
		<string>YES</string>
	</array>
	<key>RunAtLoad</key>
	<true/>
	<key>WorkingDirectory</key>
	<string>/Applications/TeamViewer.app/Contents/MacOS</string>
</dict>
</plist>
```

@soyuka No errors running those commands either..  
The only .plist files i have are the same as @PierrickMartos.  Just in case here is the PM2.plist that is generated:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
  <dict>
	  <key>Label</key>
	  <string>com.PM2</string>
	  <key>UserName</key>
	  <string>NYPortal</string>
    <key>KeepAlive</key>
    <true/>
	  <key>ProgramArguments</key>
	  <array>
		  <string>/bin/sh</string>
		  <string>-c</string>
		  <string>/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/bin/pm2 resurrect</string>
	  </array>
	  <key>RunAtLoad</key>
	  <true/>
	  <key>OnDemand</key>
	  <false/>
	  <key>LaunchOnlyOnce</key>
	  <true/>
	  <key>EnvironmentVariables</key>
    <dict>
      <key>PATH</key>
      <string>/usr/local/Cellar/node/7.4.0/bin</string>
      <key>PM2_HOME</key>
      <string>/Users/channel1/.pm2</string>
    </dict>
	  <key>StandardErrorPath</key>
	  <string>/tmp/com.PM2.err</string>
	  <key>StandardOutPath</key>
	  <string>/tmp/com.PM2.out</string>
  </dict>
</plist>
```

Hmm, this seems wrong, but may still be correct:

```
	  <key>ProgramArguments</key>
	  <array>
		  <string>/bin/sh</string>
		  <string>-c</string>
		  <string>/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/bin/pm2 resurrect</string>
	  </array>
```

Did you install nodejs with brew? Does the binary `/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/bin/pm2` exists?

After running the `launchctl start ~/Library/LaunchAgents/PM2.plist` command, is there anything in `/tmp/com.PM2.err` or `/tmp/com.PM2.out`?

Thanks!

I installed node with brew & pm2 with npm.

The following file exists:

    /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/bin/pm2

Contents /tmp/com.PM2.err:

    [PM2][ERROR] No processes saved; DUMP file doesn't exist

Contents /tmp/com.PM2.err (portals is my app):

```
[PM2] Resurrecting
[PM2] Restoring processes located in /Users/channel1/.pm2/dump.pm2
┌──────────┬────┬──────┬──────┬────────┬─────────┬────────┬─────┬───────────┬──────────┐
│ App name │ id │ mode │ pid  │ status │ restart │ uptime │ cpu │ mem       │ watching │
├──────────┼────┼──────┼──────┼────────┼─────────┼────────┼─────┼───────────┼──────────┤
│ portals  │ 0  │ fork │ 4647 │ online │ 0       │ 25h    │ 0%  │ 47.7 MB   │ enabled  │
└──────────┴────┴──────┴──────┴────────┴─────────┴────────┴─────┴───────────┴──────────┘
 Use `pm2 show <id|name>` to get more details about an app
```

So it did find the dump file after all?

Can you do this :

```
launchctl start ~/Library/LaunchAgents/PM2.plist
echo $?
```

What exit code did you get?

In fact the exit code `3` means:

```
❯ launchctl error 3
3: No such process
```

Anyway, as long as it's loaded with the `launchctl load` command I don't think that we need to start it and it should be there on reboot anyway. Does pm2 get started when you reboot your computer?

Thanks for those debugging informations @PierrickMartos  and @arctelix
